course_title: Special Topics in Accounting: Strategic Cost Management
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 36 / Seats Avail: 10Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course covers the internal generation and interpretation of information for strategic and operational decision-making purposes, which is of paramount importance for decision-making in organizations, irrespective of function (sales, marketing, operations, procurement, finance, accounting, and other functions). You will learn how to identify information that is relevant for decision-making, cost and revenue behavior, different costing techniques, profit planning, customer profitability analysis, and how to evaluate performance against plans. This course is especially useful if you are interested in consulting and will prepare you for your interviews with consulting companies.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
